fields.description: Would like to have the ability to enforce entering of a Jira user story/defect prior to allowing a commit into a Bitbucket repository.
fields.summary: Add ability to create pre-commit hooks

fields.description: I've set up a new test repo and added a web hook to it. The web hook is running a valid SSL but we are seeing no POST data coming through. We are seeing the URL being hit, but a dump of the GET, POST and REQUEST data is showing no payload information.
fields.summary: New webook sending no POST data

fields.description:
Please improve the basic filtering to discourage users from posting "+1" or "me too" comments on issues. Issue #BB-7016 currently has nearly 350 comments, the _vast_ majority of which are just "+1" etc.

There are apparently some people who cannot comprehend the concept that every new comment sends a reply to the _hundreds_ of people watching the issue, filling their mailboxes with useless notices.
fields.summary: Better prevention of '+1' comments on issues (BB-13534)

fields.description:
Branch management's user search autocomplete pops at the very bottom of browser.

If the branch management page need to be scrolled to see the rest of configuration, clicking on Edit and trying to find a user is pretty much impossible as the page can't be scrolled anymore with the _Edit branch restriction_ visible.
fields.summary: Branch management's user search autocomplete pops at the very bottom of browser

fields.description:
I'm developing 'Report Problem' dialog, to allow users submit an issue into my bitbucket repository using their account, right from my page. All works fine using OAuth if I'm logged in to bitbucket already. But if I'm not, login screen is supposed to appear in dialog iframe, but browser refuses to load it because of X-Frame-Options header set to 'SAMEORIGIN'.

I understand it may be in purpose (see issue#7812), but also it looks like it nullifies OAuth scenario.

May be it should be slightly improved, so that X-Frame-Options header is not sent if it's coming from (referrer or next query param is equal to) /api/1.0/oauth/authenticate?
fields.summary: Refused to display 'https://bitbucket.org/account/signin/?next=/api/1.0/oauth/authenticate/...' in a frame because it set 'X-Frame-Options' to 'SAMEORIGIN'

Custom URLs seems to not work anymore; even the example URLs given in this documentation does not work:

"tortoisehg.bitbucket.org" and "tutorials.bitbucket.org" leads back to https://bitbucket.org/

https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg and https://bitbucket.org/tutorials seems to work fine though.

I've created my own custom URL according to the documentation above, and it does not work - leads back to https://bitbucket.org/ as well.

Image info: 1600 x 1940 PNG

Just tested this in IE and it works fine (has the circular cutout, etc). When you go to upload a repo logo in Chrome, at the point where you can drag it to position where the circle mask is, if you try to drag it the Chrome tab will crash with the "Aw, Snap!" error page.

The circular mask is also not present on Chrome.

Please also show that reason in the overview so it can be seen in the initial view, together with all that other general stuff.

fields.description: The bitbucket team does not act on these issues.  It gives false hope to users that you will listen to them so I suggest you just kill this.
fields.summary: Kill this issue tracker since you clearly ignore it

fields.description:
_Steps to reproduce_:

* Manage a team.
* Click on plans and billing.
* In Direct Access section click "view repositories" to view what each user can view.

The button will keep loading, but with nothing. If you look in the browser console you will see the AJAX request is failing with a HTTP 500 Internal Server Error.
fields.summary: Error when clicking "view repositories" in plans and billing (BB-13454)

fields.description:
We have a script cleaning up repositories used for deployment of applications. This involves deleting and creating repos, but within the last week the delete a repo api has stopped working.

Here is a quick curl example to reproduce\\
curl -sX DELETE -u $apikey:x-oauth-basic -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/$bitbucket_user/$bitbucket_repo

Response\\
{"error": {"message": "This API has been deprecated and is not available through OAuth2 or JWT"}}
fields.summary: Delete repo v2 api returns deprecated response (BB-13649)

fields.description: It's very simple to accidentally change a repo from private to public. For companies using BitBucket to store company secrets and source code, that could be a big issue. Making it a little harder to change that setting, by requiring typing in a word or confirming the change could go a long way to improving usability.
fields.summary: Make switching between private and public repos harder (BB-13637)

I went back to my manage account link, clicked the resend confirmation link , again got a confirm here email, clicked it and again got the same message

We were unable to confirm the email address. The validation email may have expired.

fields.description:
Hi,

Actually when you're in the reviewers of a PR, you're getting notified for any little thing. I have something like 30 to 50 notifications a day, so important info are getting drown into this unstoppable flow. Everyone at my job have just created a gmail rule : receive & trash any bitbucket mail.

I would love to be able to do a few adjustments :

* Ignore some users (I have a user called "Robot CCM Benchmark" which is just our continuous deployment tool - i don't want to receive any news from him).
* Ignore some actions (on some PR I don't want to be notified for any other approval or merge).

The cherry on the cake : i would like to set params for my account and override those params for a specific PR.

Thanks for your feedback,
fields.summary: Pull Request : chose notification for every step

In debug mode this line hangs the app (it waits for the query fetch)

...\\

...

When I go to the:\\
http://localhost:8000/datastore?namespace=en&kind=Show

I see 18 entries, all verified.\\
Please check my env. (the best would be with skype). Great thanks in advance.

P.S.\\

http://localhost:8080/seederDE
{code}

Regards,\\
Marcin

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# Go to a pull request that has file changes shown for a file so that it does not show all the lines at the start of the file and instead shows that {{...}} ellipses button for loading additional lines
# Add a comment for that file (not for a specific line but for the file itself).
# Add a task on that comment.
# Press the {{...}} ellipses button for loading additional lines at the start of that file
# The added task will get duplicated many times
fields.summary: Bitbucket pull request file comment/task bug causing the tasks to get duplicated in the UI

fields.description:
Funny BitBucket bug.

Go to a pull request that has file changes shown for a file so that it does not show all the lines at the start of the file and instead shows that {{...}} ellipses button for loading additional lines

Then add a comment for that file (not for a specific line but for the file itself).

Then add a task on that comment.

Now press the {{...}} ellipses button for loading additional lines at the start of that file... and the added task will get duplicated many times.

Some extra (and most likely unimportant) information: At the time I did this I also already had another comment in the process of being added for that same file, two other comments and a task added for a previous file, and several line comments & tasks throughout the whole pull request.

Using FireFox 38.0.5 on Windows 8.

*Extra edit:*

The fact that there was another comment on the same file, and that that comment was in edit mode might be relevant after all.

I just have a similar situation when one of the file level comments was in edit mode and then I pressed the {{...}} ellipses button that comment's text edit control got displayed 4 times instead of just once. Pressing {{Cancel}} on the last displayed text edit control got rid of all of them.

Also, some extra notes on the {{extra tasks displayed}} scenario in the in the original problem report description:

* checking/unchecking the extra task check-boxes seems to turn them on/off in groups of three
* reloading the page got rid of most of the extra tasks, but it seems one per the {{...}} ellipses button click remained and needed to be deleted explicitly afterwards
fields.summary: BitBucket pull request UI duplicating tasks when loading extra lines (BB-13418)
login

fields.description:
Hi,

I've registered a simple new webhook (just a Runscope capture, so I can view the content of the posts), but every hook is timing out:

!2829515801-Capture.PNG|thumbnail!

All the Runscope endpoint does is log the request and respond with a simple 200 response with some JSON debugging info in it. It worked for the old "Pull Request POST" _service_.

Am I doing something wrong here? Is there a specific response that the new webhooks require? Or is this a genuine bug with the new service?
fields.summary: New Webhooks feature timing out for all requests. (BB-13419)

I was creating an issue on a page with a path similar to this:\\
https://bitbucket.org/username/project/issues/new

I completed the whole thing, went to save, and by some misfortune accidentally refreshed the page, and lost everything!

This could have been prevented by prompting the user before exit.  The prompt should only show up when some changes have been made on the page.
fields.summary: Add user prompt for exiting browser before saving wiki. (BB-13420)

fields.description:
Problem:\\
The pull request could not be created if there has been some other commits to repository. The problem is that the XHR requests does not return any errors and the user gets no information why the creation fails.

Expected:\\
There should be at least error message which show information to user why the creation failed.
fields.summary: The pull request could not be created (BB-13421)

fields.description:
The bitbucket API doesn't seems good to return data from git commits, it's hard to get all commits from a repo in order, or filter those data.\\
I suggest a new API command to changesets that return date of commit, author, message.\\
Filters for date and branch.

fields.description:
Hi!\\
Newbie here!\\
Im following Michael Hartl's tutorial and I need to push things into my repo on bitbucket put I get this.\\
cd /path/to/my/repo\\
git remote add origin https://xxxx@bitbucket.org/xxxx/sitename.git (this works)\\
git push -u origin --all (this doesnt)

And this is what I get from the terminal\\
! [rejected]        master -> master (non-fast-forward)\\
error: failed to push some refs to 'git@bitbucket.org:palomanat/hello_app.git'\\
hint: Updates were rejected because the tip of your current branch is behind\\
hint: its remote counterpart. Integrate the remote changes (e.g.\\
hint: 'git pull ...') before pushing again.\\
hint: See the 'Note about fast-forwards' in 'git push --help' for details.
fields.summary: Cant push things into my repo

fields.description: I could push using cloud to bit bucket, but when I tried to do the same on my virtual machine running Ubuntu for hello_app, it says public key is invalid. I saved the key in the directory ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub, this key can be seen as the latest key of the 3 ssh keys created in Bitbucket. I also do not understand why Ubuntu created 2 different keys when I tried creating the key 2 times. Both these keys are in the Bitbucket but in Ubuntu I erased the first key (number 2 in Bitbucket) and replaced with the second key (number 3 in the Bitbucket). The number one key was from cloud environment and it worked fine.

fields.description:
Hi, there are a couple of places where source code in my Markdown gets rendered with <span class="err"> surrounding it.  For example:

h2. Test
{code}
POST /api/a
GET /api/b
POST /api/c
GET /api/d

POST /api/f

fields.summary: Markdown rendered with span class="err" (BB-13628)

fields.description:
Diffstat API is not working for commits on pull requests with status Open and with "project maintainer" username/repository in the URL - it will respond with a 404 (NOT FOUND)

Take this public repository for example:

https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/atlassian/jiraconnect-ios/changesets/623dd28c5dc2810adbec42c2e960ea95f83ed18b/diffstat (does not work)

https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/jdevenny/jiraconnect-ios-doco/changesets/623dd28c5dc2810adbec42c2e960ea95f83ed18b/diffstat (works perfectly)

For Merged and Declined pull requests though, either "project maintainer" or "developer" username/repository in the URL works fine. Take this declined pull request commit for example:

https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/atlassian/jiraconnect-ios/changesets/97e351c369976d4dd6f84dcddc021871420fe0c4/diffstat (works perfectly)

https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/booiiing/jiraconnect-ios/changesets/97e351c369976d4dd6f84dcddc021871420fe0c4/diffstat (works perfectly)
fields.summary: Diffstat API not working for commits on Open pull requests; it works for Merged and Declined pull requests.

fields.description:
Currently, when you're added to a PR, you receive emails every time something happens on that PR: commits, approvals, merging, comments, mentions, etc.

Ideally, the user should be able to choose what types of emails they default receive from PRs. Personally, commit emails can get overwhelming and drown out more important emails about comments and mentions.
fields.summary: Be able to choose what emails you receive from a pull request (BB-13573)
Forking from team repository doesn't inherit user/group permissions (BB-13317)

fields.description:
When I go to create a repo by default it creates under durin42 and not the team I'm also part of. When I go to create a snippet, the opposite is true - it defaults to the team, instead of me. I nearly always want to create things under me, not the team, but I can envision that being the wrong default for many users.

Could we get a setting that would let us specify where repos and snippets get created by default?

Thanks!

(marked as snippets because the snippets behavior doesn't match the repos behavior, but YMMV)
fields.summary: Allow me to specify default location for repos/snippets (BB-13423)

fields.description:
Hi

I just wanted to ask if it would be possible to add "*AutoHotkey*" to your Bitbucket languages category (to choose if you open a new Bitbucket repository). AutoHotkey is similar in it's usage like "AutoIt" but it's not compatible. There are two competing websites for it:

http://www.autohotkey.com/\\
http://ahkscript.org/

Thanks a lot for your help and have a nice day!

Best regards

Patrick
fields.summary: Add AutoHotkey to repo language choices (BB-13574)

fields.description:
Hi,

I've recently got a warning about the 1GB limit on my repository, so I decided I reduce the size. I did it with the hg convert extension in my local folder, I've excluded some binaries. The new size is ~250MByte. After that I stripped the whole repo on the web and pushed the new one. I've tested with cloning the new repository, and the size is correct (250 MB).

The problem is the warning is still present, and when I enter into settings, it says the repository size is still 1.3GB. What can I do? Do I have to delete the whole repo and recreate it?
fields.summary: Repository size doesn't refresh

fields.description:
I'm glad Bitbucket has support for Github's table syntax which is very helpful.\\ However it is not possible to add newlines in table cells like it is on GitHub using
HTML tag. I tried to check out Atlassian's Markdown syntax reference (https://confluence.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/remotepageview?pageId=312740094#Markdownsyntaxguide-Markdownsyntax) but it looks like the page is completely broken. Please add support for
, thanks!

fields.description:
Now every time we want to check pull-request, we have to navigate in 3-4 clicks for every request to view issue status in agile. That would be great to see it on the same page just to know if it's time to merge.\\
Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Easily view JIRA issue status in pull-requests page (BB-13576)

fields.description:
Hi to all.\\
I'm using OAuth to authenticate to BB.\\
I check that it works, trying to list all repos, and it gives me also the private repos owned by me.

If i try to post a new issue, it gives me 401 UNAUTHORIZED

Here are the header sent:

{code}

POST https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/eliosh/gestsdn2/issues/24/comments HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: Drupal (+http://drupal.org/)
Content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-length: 36
Accept: application/json
Authorization: OAuth oauth_version="1.0",oauth_nonce="xxx",oauth_timestamp="x",oauth_consumer_key="x",oauth_token="x",oauth_signature_method="x",oauth_signature="x"
Host: bitbucket.org

content=Speriamo+che+funzioni+adesso


{code}

and those are header received

{code}
HTTP/1.1 401 UNAUTHORIZED
Server: nginx/1.6.2
Date: Thu, 04 Jun 2015 08:56:25 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 0
Connection: keep-alive
X-Served-By: app15
X-Render-Time: 0.0166809558868
Content-Language: en
X-Static-Version: 178574514dce
Vary: Accept-Language, Cookie
X-Version: 57a526a7704d
ETag: "x"
X-Request-Count: 69
X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
WWW-Authenticate: Basic realm="Bitbucket.org HTTP"
{code}

How can i solve this problem?

Thanks a lot
fields.summary: API: private repo, private tracker, unable to create / update / post comment on issue

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Go to https://bitbucket.org/repo/create
# Create repository with name of non-ascii characters and '.', for example 'тест.тест'
# Repository is created, but is unreachable (URL created as/leads to "https://bitbucket.org/username/")

This issue will cause repositories with internationalized domain name impossible to be accessed into.
fields.summary: Repository not accessible when it's name consists of non-ascii and '.'

fields.description: When creating a pull request, it would be useful to allow the author to specify approximately how complex the review might be.  This can give a guide to reviewers when deciding which PRs to review first.
fields.summary: Allow pull request creator to specify how complex of a review this is (BB-13642)

fields.description: It would be useful to show the total number of lines changed by the Pull request in order to help prioritize which requests to review first.  If I have several pull requests that I need to review, this can help me knock out some of the easier ones first.  Lines of code changed isn't a perfect metric for evaluating how complex a review will be, but it is a reasonable proxy much of the time.
fields.summary: Display number of lines changed on the pull request list page

fields.description:
If the pull request branch is connected with a JIRA (or Bitbucket) issue, it would be nice to see what the priority of that issue is directly from the Pull Requests summary page.

When I have multiple pull requests that I need to review, this would be useful to help me prioritize which should be reviewed first.
fields.summary: Display issue priority on pull requests summary page (BB-13641)

fields.description:
Hi,

Why is that the POST hook seems to be buggy? Sometimes the Payload has a complete data. Then sometimes it doesn't. It is becoming useless as it will not sync the prod because the payload is empty. What should I do to fix this?
fields.summary: POST Hook Empty Payload

fields.description: Currently, when making API calls to retrieve commits on a pull request, the commit hashes gets turnicated. It should return the full commit hash.
fields.summary: Pull Request API should return full commit hash (BB-14633)

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm trying to clone https://larsskj@bitbucket.org/hpk42/devpi.

I've tried the standard Debian git client version 1.7.10.4 which complains:

_fatal: https://larsskj@bitbucket.org/hpk42/devpi/info/refs not found: did you run git update-server-info on the server?_

I've tried Git Gui version 0.19.GITGUI on Windows which complains

_fatal: repository 'https://larsskj@bitbucket.org/hpk42/devpi/' not found_

and I've tried eGit on Eclipse/Windows which gives a similar error and a long list of proposed remedies.

How is this supposed to work?

Regards,\\
Lars
fields.summary: Cannot clone using HTTPS

This is related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-43229

Here is our instance: https://360vantage.jira.com

fields.description:
It could be great if we could add Ansible to the available languages in the repository details.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Add Ansible to available languages in repository details

fields.description:
When nesting lists in markdown, the inner list has a top margin that separates it visually from its parent. Example:

* Top level list

** Nested item 1
** nested item 2
* Second level list

A {{li > ul { margin: 0; }}} seems to fix it
fields.summary: Nested lists in the wiki (Markdown) have awkward styling (BB-13437)

fields.description: At the moment, we have a CI service doing commits, however, there is no way to 'link' the author, we call 'Mr Jenkins' to an icon in the BB interface. Would it be possible to facilitate something like this?
fields.summary: Commit icon for CI service (BB-13436)

fields.description:
We have a well defined continuous delivery pipeline that, as part of it's process, merges changes from master to a reviewed branch and pushes that back to bitbucket.

Recently a "feature" was released that returns a remote message about pull requests when we do a remote push, even with the -q option in git. This is problematic for us because that message is shown in stderr and our build process assumes that any unexpected errors (ie, stuff in stderr when we use the -q option for git push) is an error, so it fails the build step.

Here is what we run and the message we receive:

{code}
#!text

git push -q origin reviewed

remote: Create pull request for reviewed:
remote: https://bitbucket.org/precisionlender/pl-application/pull-request/new?source=reviewed&t=1
{code}

We have also noticed this text is not returned consistently. So that particular build step fails several times in a row and then starts working again, then fails occasionally and starts working again.

Please turn off this unnecessary remote message or make it an option that people can opt-in on. Given that it always reports the same URL, I'm not sure it's providing any value.
fields.summary: Revert/Modify "Create Pull Request" message on remote push commands (BB-13435)

fields.description:
Step to reproduce error

Login in your Account with a Iphone 5s using safary.\\
Go to a repository  -> https://bitbucket.org/user/repository\\
Click on Share or Send Invitation does not display a popup message.

Regards
fields.summary: Share and Send Invitation does not display in safari  (Iphone 5s ) (BB-13434)

fields.description:
As https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/8730 is done and the submodule changes are shown as a simple refs, this is just a good start but not as convenient as it could be.

The next step to make it usable is to provide a button or a link near submodule change section to show real subproject changes.

For example if the target subproject belongs to bitbucket, the link would lead to https://bitbucket.org/<OWNER>/<PROJECT>/branches/compare/<NEW_COMMIT>..<OLD_COMMIT>
fields.summary: Display detailed submodule changes in diffs

fields.description: Snippets can be Private (visible only to to the owner) or Public (listed on the owner's profile).  It'd be great if there was a third option, Link-Only, that didn't show up on the user's profile, but was visible to anyone with the link.
fields.summary: Link-only privacy level for snippets (BB-13432)

fields.description:
I recently revisited [a BB project|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o] I haven't used for awhile. In section='Recent activity' on page='Overview', I saw

bq. HowToUseJira\\
Wiki page deleted in tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o\\
Iridian Kiiskinen · 2014-08-03


bq. HowToUseJira\\
Wiki page created in tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o\\
Iridian Kiiskinen · 2014-08-03


which surprised me. (It may also reflect a bug in wiki-related notification--see [this question|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/15828101/get-notification-on-bitbucket-wiki-updates-webhook].) Investigating that edit (which I hadn't authorized) I noticed that, in the project's [{{Settings>Wiki settings}}|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o/admin/wiki], checkbox={{Allow anyone with access to the repository to edit the wiki}} was _set_! This seems to be the default for wiki type={{Public wiki}}, since I don't recall ever setting that, and it seems to be set on all my other public projects.

I *strongly* suspect that most BB project owners/admins expect their public wikis to be publicly _readable_ but not publicly _writable_: ICBW, but see comments to [this issue|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/2462/allow-admins-to-specify-read-write-admin]. Hence I encourage BB to, in some manner, expose the relevant {{Wiki settings}} when [creating a repository|https://bitbucket.org/repo/create].
fields.summary: expose BB wiki editability when creating repository

fields.description:
It would be nice if there was a Bitbucket equivalent of [GitHub Releases|https://github.com/blog/1547-release-your-software]. The main benefit of this feature in GitHub is the ability to attach a set of files and release notes to a tag, and see the recent tags in order on a repository.

One way this could work could be an improved version of Bitbucket Downloads which shows the recent releases of a library or software package, with release notes and artifacts attached.
fields.summary: Attach release notes and artifacts to tags, similar to GitHub Releases (BB-13572)

fields.description:
Hello,

I create an account with username *vietlabs* but it immediately disable.

Please help.
fields.summary: Account disabled after registration

I created a new empty Git repository called "torux.git", but when I attempt to manage it (at the URL https://bitbucket.org/gorbachev/torux.git) the web UI shows me the "torux" repository instead.

https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-19634

Is there a way to include search tags for a repo so you can search for it without changing the repo name itself?

_Note: Including the repo description is probably too broad since some descriptions are quite lengthy._

fields.description:
The REST API to accept and merge a pull request (according to this page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/pullrequests+Resource#pullrequestsResource-Acceptandmergeapullrequest) does not work. Steps to reproduce:

1.. I forked a repository, and created a pull request back to the original repository. There's no warning on a conflict:

!3126376220-pullrequest_api.PNG|thumbnail!

2.. Trying to merge pull request via API (through http://restbrowser.bitbucket.org/); says there's conflict:

!1836393328-pullrequest_api2.png|thumbnail!

3.. Can merge just fine via UI without any conflict:

!1757003389-pullrequest_api3.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: REST API to accept and merge a pull request does not work (BB-13430)

fields.description: We have had users who somehow create public repositories within our team, which they fully intend to be private.. it's been an ongoing problem ever since we started using Bitbucket.  It would be great if we could restrict that from happening, or just have a way to make sure all repos created under the team are always private without a user having to check/uncheck a box.
fields.summary: Add ability to restrict creating public repositories for team.

fields.description:
The tutorial at https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/comparing-workflows is\\
great, however....

... it leads users down the wrong path in the case of open source projects.  On a typical OS project members can't push to the master repository, they need to fork first and then make a pull request.

So maybe this document could be separated into a version for teams, and a version for outsiders contributing to an open project.
fields.summary: Tutorial does not make clear permissions (BB-13429)

fields.description:
Something went wrong while creating your pull request.\\
I cant create pull request

I always have this error "Something went wrong while creating your pull request."
fields.summary: Can't create pull request

fields.description:
Curved brackets are not escaped in image upload path, resulting in non-working link after file-upload.

{code}
"(" => %28
")" => %29
{code}

!3416164244-2015-05-27%2019_20_28-(Foo).png|thumbnail!

!2375099170-2015-05-27%2019_21_56-%28Foo%29.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Curved brackets "(" and ")" not escaped in image upload path. (BB-13428)

fields.description:
I believe this page needs to make it more clear that the permissions set on this page are *default* permissions that will be applied to all repositories.

The current text for each group says 'Admins have <read/write/no/etc> access to this account's repositories'

I propose it should say 'Admins have *default* <read/write/no/etc> access to this account's repositories'.

h2. Here is what got me to this scenario.
All I wanted to do was create a group, add users to the group, and give the users of the group write permissions to one repository.

Instead of knowing to set the access to 'no' for the group and adding the group to the repository, I had to spend over an hour of searching and reading documentation to understand this (seeing the word default in the documentation on your website).

The current way it's written is confusing and would be easily solved by having the word 'default'. It makes me think that if you select 'No' for a group, the user/group will have no access to any repository no matter what. It could also mean that those are the highest possible permissions for people in the group and it can only get more restrictive when setting stuff under the repository's permissions.

I don't see how adding this word in a couple spots on the page will harm productivity, but I do see how omitting it hinders productivity. Default needs to appear somewhere on this page in order to clear up this confusion.
fields.summary: Text under Manage Account -> Access Management -> User Groups (BB-13427)

fields.description:
Currently in commit view messages are displayed as text (therefore uses Arial font) and if ASCII art is used the image gets distorted. I know it does not bring in any functionality but changing this shouldn't break anything as well and allow to bring in some playfulness into commit messages.

I've attached a few images of how embers initial commit looks in text and in raw to better illustrate the issue.
fields.summary: Display commit message with monospaced font (BB-13639)

fields.description:

fields.description:
Hi team,

When I trying to push some code to bitbuket, it returns ssl error, do you have any idea about how to fix that?\\
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false pull origin master\\
fatal: unable to access 'https://kavipokhariya@bitbucket.org/webmasterpcj/demopcj.git/': Unknown SSL protocol error in connection to bitbucket.org:443

Completed with errors, see above.

Thanks,\\
Kavi
fields.summary: Git Pull Issue

fields.description:
I created a test repository in order to test POST hooks

https://bitbucket.org/eradman/hook-test

Then added a hook with the following URL:

http://eradman.com:9003/

Next I started a simple test server:

{code}
::::ruby
require "json"
require "sinatra"

set :port, 9003
set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

post '/' do
    reply = {:status=>"ok"}
    puts params
    reply.to_json
end
{code}

When I push commits to this test repo nothing seems to happen. Are hooks broken\\
or did I miss something?
fields.summary: POST hook does not appear to work on test repository

fields.description:
Users with no write access to the repository are allowed to create a fork with the changes, as well as creating a pull request to be submitted back to the original repository.

However, there's a bug that cause the process to create that Pull Request to hang, and the cancel button does not work as well:

!120339666-inline.PNG|thumbnail!

The fork with the changes is successfully created though.
fields.summary: Creating Pull Request fails when users with no write access edit/commit source files. (BB-13426)

fields.description:
According to http://www.wikicreole.org/wiki/Newlines, triple-slashes should force a paragraph, but it does not seem to work. It accepts the double-slashes that forces a new line though:

!1776076148-newparagraph.PNG|thumbnail!

!2838758314-newparagraph2.PNG|thumbnail!

The workaround is to use multiple double-slashes to cause a few new lines to make it seem like a new paragraph.
fields.summary: Creole's triple-slashes to force a paragraph function not working (BB-13640)

fields.description:
Writing code it is appropriate to limit line length (e.g. 80 characters). However, when using git to track documents with a sentence on each line these are often longer than the screen width will allow and there is linking sense in breaking a sentence onto separate lines.

Could the option to line wrap be added for looking at raw files and also when looking at diffs?
fields.summary: Line wrap raw files and diff (BB-13425)

fields.description:
we need to have the capability that some of our team members, can only access wiki and issues tracker and not the source codes.

currently, if I give a team member write access, he has access to the source and issues/wiki.
fields.summary: access right for wiki/ issue tracker
